en.hunt-1-opening-1: Animals need energy to perform their life processes.
en.hunt-1-opening-2: This is Mr.Fox and he needs your help!
en.hunt-1-opening-3: Mr. Fox need food for energy, look over there! Mr.Fox's craving for rabbits
en.hunt-1-opening-4: Hold down Mr.Fox and flick him like a catapult to move him
en.hunt-1-success-1: Good job! Now hunt more rabbit to complete the level!
en.hunt-1-complete-1: Nice work now Mr.Fox is having a feast!
en.eat-1-opening-1: Mr.Fox is hungry, lets give him the rabbit meat!
en.eat-1-opening-2: Drag and drop the meat on Mr.Fox's mouth, tap the screen to chew.
en.eat-1-complete-1: Stored chemical energy is released when food is digested.
en.energy-1-opening-1: The chemical energy in food can be transformed into motion energy that allows an animal to move its body.
en.energy-1-opening-2: Let's distribute the energy to Mr.Fox's body!
en.energy-1-opening-3: Link the energy lines in order to complete the level!
en.energy-1-complete-1: In the process of metabolism, food is broken down into forms of energy that can be used for an animalâ€™s growth.
en.energy-1-complete-2: Mr.Fox has grown stronger! good job!
en.hunt-2-opening-1: Lookout not to hit trees and rocks, Mr.Fox doesn't like being hurt
en.hunt-2-opening-2: Uh-oh Looks like Mr.Fox is hurt!
en.hunt-2-opening-3: Energy also can be used for an animal's body repair
en.hunt-2-opening-4: Come on! Mr.Fox needs more food!
en.eat-2-opening-1: Uh-oh! Watch out for the Poisonus mushrooms!
en.eat-2-opening-2: You can discard it into the trash can!
